abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
          <jats:p>We sequenced 11 germline exomes from five families with familial pancreatic cancer (FPC). One proband had a germline nonsense variant in <jats:italic>ATM</jats:italic> with somatic loss of the variant allele. Another proband had a nonsense variant in <jats:italic>PALB2</jats:italic> with somatic loss of the variant allele. Both variants were absent in a relative with FPC. These findings question the causal mechanisms of <jats:italic>ATM</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>PALB2</jats:italic> in these families and highlight challenges in identifying the causes of familial cancer syndromes using exome sequencing.</jats:p>
publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

reference.author: NJ Roberts
reference.unstructured: Roberts NJ, Jiao Y, Yu J, Kopelovich L, Petersen GM, Bondy ML, Gallinger S, Schwartz AG, Syngal S, Cote ML, Axilbund J, Schulick R, Ali SZ, Eshleman JR, Velculescu VE, Goggins M, Vogelstein B, Papadopoulos N, Hruban RH, Kinzler KW, Klein AP: ATM mutations in patients with hereditary pancreatic cancer. Cancer Discov. 2012, 2 (1): 41-46. 10.1158/2159-8290.CD-11-0194.

reference.author: S Jones
reference.unstructured: Jones S, Hruban RH, Kamiyama M, Borges M, Zhang X, Parsons DW, Lin JC, Palmisano E, Brune K, Jaffee EM, Iacobuzio-Donahue CA, Maitra A, Parmigiani G, Kern SE, Velculescu VE, Kinzler KW, Vogelstein B, Eshleman JR, Goggins M, Klein AP: Exomic sequencing identifies PALB2 as a pancreatic cancer susceptibility gene. Science. 2009, 324 (5924): 217-10.1126/science.1171202.

Gastroenterology. 2009, 137 (3): 1183-1186. 10.1053/j.gastro.2009.06.055.

reference.author: AV Biankin
reference.unstructured: Biankin AV, Waddell N, Kassahn KS, Gingras MC, Muthuswamy LB, Johns AL, Miller DK, Wilson PJ, Patch AM, Wu J, Chang DK, Cowley MJ, Gardiner BB, Song S, Harliwong I, Idrisoglu S, Nourse C, Nourbakhsh E, Manning S, Wani S, Gongora M, Pajic M, Scarlett CJ, Gill AJ, Pinho AV, Rooman I, Anderson M, Holmes O, Leonard C, Taylor D: Pancreatic cancer genomes reveal aberrations in axon guidance pathway genes. Nature. 2012, 491 (7424): 399-405. 10.1038/nature11547.

title: Exome sequencing identifies nonsegregating nonsense ATM and PALB2variants in familial pancreatic cancer
